00024 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
00025 
00026 #include <stdio.h>
00027 #include "mcstd.h"
00028 #include "esone.h"
00029 
00030 #ifndef INLINE
00031 #if defined( _MSC_VER )
00032 #define INLINE __inline
00033 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
00034 #define INLINE __inline__
00035 #else
00036 #define INLINE
00037 #endif

00039 
00040 /*-- external representation added to MCSTD ------------------------*/
00041 
00042 INLINE void came_cn(int *ext, const int b, const int c, const int n, const int a)
00043 {
00044    *ext = (b << 24 | (c << 16) | (n << 8) | a);
00045 }
00046 
00047 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00048 INLINE void came_ext(const int ext, int *b, int *c, int *n, int *a)
00049 {
00050    *b = (ext >> 24) & 0x7;
00051    *c = (ext >> 16) & 0x7;
00052    *n = (ext >> 8) & 0x1f;
00053 
00054    *a = (ext >> 0) & 0xf;
00055 }
00056 
00057 /*********************************************************************
00058 *  ESONE functions                                                   *
00059 *********************************************************************/
00060 
00061 /**dox***************************************************************/
00062 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
00063 
00064 /********************************************************************/
00065 /**
00066 CAMAC initialization
00067 
00068 CAMAC initialization must be called before any other ESONE
00069 subroutine call.
00070 
00071 @return void
00072 */
00073 INLINE void ccinit(void)
00074 {
00075    cam_init();
00076 }
00077 
00078 /********************************************************************/
00079 /**
00080 CAMAC initialization with return status
00081 
00082 fccinit can be called instead of ccinit to determine if the
00083 initialization was successful
00084 
00085 @return 1 for success, 0 for failure
00086 */
00087 INLINE int fccinit(void)
00088 {
00089    if (cam_init() == SUCCESS)
00090       return 1;
00091 
00092    return 0;
00093 }
00094 
00095 /********************************************************************/
00096 /**
00097 Control Declaration REGister.
00098 
00099 Compose an external address from BCNA for later use.
00100 Accessing CAMAC through ext could be faster if the external address is
00101 memory mapped to the processor (hardware dependent). Some CAMAC controller
00102 do not have this option see @ref AppendixB.
00103 @param ext external address
00104 @param b branch number (0..7)
00105 @param c crate number (0..)
00106 @param n station number (0..30)
00107 @param a sub-address (0..15)
00108 @return void
00109 */
00110 INLINE void cdreg(int *ext, const int b, const int c, const int n, const int a)
00111 {
00112    came_cn(ext, b, c, n, a);
00113 }
00114 
00115 /********************************************************************/
00116 /**
00117 Control Short Operation.
00118 
00119 16 bit operation on a given external CAMAC address.
00120 
00121 The range of the f is hardware dependent. The number indicated below are for
00122 standard ANSI/IEEE Std (758-1979) 
00123 Execute cam16i for f<8, cam16o for f>15, camc_q for (f>7 or f>23)
00124 
00125 @param f function code (0..31)
00126 @param ext external address
00127 @param d data word
00128 @param q Q response
00129 @return void
00130 */
00131 INLINE void cssa(const int f, int ext, unsigned short *d, int *q)
00132 {
00133    int b, c, n, a, x;
00134 
00135    if (f < 8) {
00136       /* read */
00137       came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00138       cam16i_q(c, n, a, f, d, &x, q);
00139    } else if (f > 15) {
00140       /* write */
00141       came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00142       cam16o_q(c, n, a, f, *d, &x, q);
00143    } else if ((f > 7) || (f > 23)) {
00144       /* command */
00145       came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00146       camc_q(c, n, a, f, q);
00147    }
00148 }
00149 
00150 /********************************************************************/
00151 /**
00152 Control Full Operation.
00153 
00154 24 bit operation on a given external CAMAC address.
00155 
00156 The range of the f is hardware dependent. The number indicated below are for
00157 standard ANSI/IEEE Std (758-1979) 
00158 Execute cam24i for f<8, cam24o for f>15, camc_q for (f>7 or f>23)
00159 
00160 @param f function code (0..31)
00161 @param ext external address
00162 @param d data long word
00163 @param q Q response
00164 @return void
00165 */
00166 INLINE void cfsa(const int f, const int ext, unsigned long *d, int *q)
00167 {
00168    int b, c, n, a, x;
00169 
00170    if (f < 8) {
00171       /* read */
00172       came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00173       cam24i_q(c, n, a, f, d, &x, q);
00174    } else if (f > 15) {
00175       /* write */
00176       came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00177       cam24o_q(c, n, a, f, *d, &x, q);
00178    } else if ((f > 7) || (f > 23)) {
00179       /* command */
00180       came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00181       camc_q(c, n, a, f, q);
00182    }
00183 }
00184 
00185 /********************************************************************/
00186 /**
00187 Control Crate Clear.
00188 
00189 Generate Crate Clear function. Execute cam_crate_clear()
00190 
00191 @param ext external address
00192 @return void
00193 */
00194 INLINE void cccc(const int ext)
00195 {
00196    int b, c, n, a;
00197 
00198    came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00199    cam_crate_clear(c);
00200 }

00203 /**
00204 Control Crate Z.
00205 
00206 Generate Dataway Initialize. Execute cam_crate_zinit()
00207 
00208 @param ext external address
00209 @return void
00210 */
00211 INLINE void cccz(const int ext)
00212 {
00213    int b, c, n, a;
00214 
00215    came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00216    cam_crate_zinit(c);
00217 }
00218 
00219 /********************************************************************/
00220 /**
00221 Control Crate I.
00222 
00223 Set or Clear Dataway Inhibit, Execute cam_inhinit_set() /clear()
00224 
00225 @param ext external address
00226 @param l action l=0 -> Clear I, l=1 -> Set I
00227 @return void
00228 */
00229 INLINE void ccci(const int ext, int l)
00230 {
00231    int b, c, n, a;
00232 
00233    came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00234    if (l)
00235       cam_inhibit_set(c);
00236    else
00237       cam_inhibit_clear(c);
00238 }
00239 
00240 /********************************************************************/
00241 /**
00242 Test Crate I.
00243 
00244 Test Crate Inhibit, Execute cam_inhibit_test()
00245 
00246 @param ext external address
00247 @param l action l=0 -> Clear I, l=1 -> Set I
00248 @return void
00249 */
00250 INLINE void ctci(const int ext, int *l)
00251 {
00252    int b, c, n, a;
00253 
00254    came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00255    *l = cam_inhibit_test(c);
00256 }
00257 
00258 /********************************************************************/
00259 /**
00260 Control Crate D.
00261 
00262 Enable or Disable Crate Demand.
00263 
00264 @param ext external address
00265 @param l action l=0 -> Clear D, l=1 -> Set D
00266 @return void
00267 */
00268 INLINE void cccd(const int ext, int l)
00269 {
00270    int b, c, n, a;
00271 
00272    came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00273 
00274    if (l)
00275       cam_interrupt_enable(c);
00276    else
00277       cam_interrupt_disable(c);
00278 }
00279 
00280 /********************************************************************/
00281 /**
00282 Control Test Crate D.
00283 
00284 Test Crate Demand.
00285 
00286 @param ext external address
00287 @param l D cleared -> l=0, D set -> l=1
00288 @return void
00289 */
00290 INLINE void ctcd(const int ext, int *l)
00291 {
00292    int b, c, n, a;
00293 
00294    came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00295    *l = cam_interrupt_test(c);
00296 }

00298 /********************************************************************/
00299 /**
00300 Control Declare LAM.
00301 
00302 Declare LAM, Identical to cdreg.
00303 
00304 @param lam external LAM address
00305 @param b branch number (0..7)
00306 @param c crate number (0..)
00307 @param n station number (0..30)
00308 @param a sub-address (0..15)
00309 @param inta implementation dependent
00310 @return void
00311 */
00312 INLINE void cdlam(int *lam, const int b, const int c, const int n,
00313                   const int a, const int inta[2])
00314 {
00315    /* inta[2] ignored */
00316    cdreg(lam, b, c, n, a);
00317 }
00318 
00319 /********************************************************************/
00320 /**
00321 Control Test Demand Present.
00322 
00323 Test the LAM register.
00324 
00325 @param ext      external LAM register address
00326 @param l        l !=0 if any LAM is set.
00327 @return void
00328 */
00329 INLINE void ctgl(const int ext, int *l)
00330 {
00331    int b, c, n, a;
00332    unsigned long lam;
00333 
00334    came_ext(ext, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00335    cam_lam_read(c, &lam);
00336    *l = (lam > 0);
00337 }
00338 
00339 /********************************************************************/
00340 /**
00341 Control Crate LAM.
00342 
00343 Enable or Disable LAM. Execute F24 for disable, F26 for enable.
00344 
00345 @param lam external address
00346 @param l action l=0 -> disable LAM , l=1 -> enable LAM
00347 @return void
00348 */
00349 INLINE void cclm(const int lam, int l)
00350 {
00351    int b, c, n, a;
00352 
00353    came_ext(lam, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00354 
00355    if (l)
00356       camc(c, n, 0, 26);
00357    else
00358       camc(c, n, 0, 24);
00359 }
00360 
00361 /********************************************************************/
00362 /**
00363 Link LAM to service procedure
00364 
00365 Link a specific service routine to a LAM. Since this routine
00366 is executed asynchronously, care must be taken on re-entrancy.
00367 
00368 @param lam external address
00369 @param isr name of service procedure
00370 @return void
00371 */
00372 INLINE void cclnk(const int lam, void (*isr) (void))
00373 {
00374    int b, c, n, a;
00375 
00376    came_ext(lam, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00377 
00378    cam_interrupt_attach(c, n, isr);
00379    cam_lam_enable(c, n);
00380    cam_lam_clear(c, n);
00381 }
00382 
00383 /********************************************************************/
00384 /**
00385 Unlink LAM from service procedure
00386 
00387 Performs complementary operation to cclnk.
00388 
00389 @param lam external address
00390 @return void
00391 */
00392 INLINE void cculk(const int lam)
00393 {
00394    int b, c, n, a;
00395 
00396    came_ext(lam, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00397    cam_interrupt_detach(c, n);
00398 }
00399 
00400 /********************************************************************/
00401 /**
00402 Relink LAM
00403 
00404 Re-enable LAM in the controller
00405 
00406 @param lam external address
00407 @return void
00408 */
00409 INLINE void ccrgl(const int lam)
00410 {
00411    int b, c, n, a;
00412 
00413    came_ext(lam, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00414 
00415    cam_lam_enable(c, n);
00416    cam_lam_clear(c, n);
00417    cam_interrupt_enable(c);
00418 }
00419 
00420 /********************************************************************/
00421 /**
00422 Control Clear LAM.
00423 
00424 Clear the LAM of the station pointer by the lam address.
00425 
00426 @param lam external address
00427 @return void
00428 */
00429 INLINE void cclc(const int lam)
00430 {
00431    int b, c, n, a;
00432 
00433    came_ext(lam, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00434    camc(c, n, 0, 10);
00435 }
00436 
00437 /********************************************************************/
00438 /**
00439 Test LAM.
00440 
00441 Test the LAM of the station pointed by lam. Performs an F8
00442 
00443 @param lam external address
00444 @param l No LAM-> l=0, LAM present-> l=1
00445 @return void
00446 */
00447 INLINE void ctlm(const int lam, int *l)
00448 {
00449    int b, c, n, a;
00450 
00451    came_ext(lam, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00452    camc_q(c, n, a, 8, l);
00453 }
00454 
00455 /********************************************************************/
00456 /**
00457 Control Full (24bit) word General Action.
00458 
00459 @param f function code
00460 @param exta[] external address array
00461 @param intc[] data array
00462 @param qa[] Q response array
00463 @param cb[] control block array<br>
00464 cb[0] : number of function to perform<br>
00465 cb[1] : returned number of function performed
00466 @return void
00467 */
00468 INLINE void cfga(int f[], int exta[], int intc[], int qa[], int cb[])
00469 {
00470    int i;
00471 
00472    for (i = 0; i < cb[0]; i++)
00473       cfsa(f[i], exta[i], (unsigned long *) (&(intc[i])), &(qa[i]));
00474 
00475    cb[1] = cb[0];
00476 }
00477 
00478 /********************************************************************/
00479 /**
00480 Control (16bit) word General Action.
00481 
00482 @param f function code
00483 @param exta[] external address array
00484 @param intc[] data array
00485 @param qa[] Q response array
00486 @param cb[] control block array <br>
00487 cb[0] : number of function to perform<br>
00488 cb[1] : returned number of function performed
00489 @return void
00490 */
00491 INLINE void csga(int f[], int exta[], int intc[], int qa[], int cb[])
00492 {
00493    int i;
00494 
00495    for (i = 0; i < cb[0]; i++)
00496       cssa(f[i], exta[i], (unsigned short *) (&(intc[i])), &(qa[i]));
00497 
00498    cb[1] = cb[0];
00499 }
00500 
00501 /********************************************************************/
00502 /** 
00503 Control Full (24bit) Address Q scan.
00504 
00505 Scan all sub-address while Q=1 from a0..a15 max from address extb[0] and store
00506 corresponding data in intc[]. If Q=0 while A<15 or A=15 then cross station boundary is applied
00507 (n-> n+1) and sub-address is reset (a=0). Perform action until either cb[0] action are performed
00508 or current external address exceeds extb[1].
00509 
00510 <b>implementation of cb[2] for LAM recognition is not implemented.</b>
00511 
00512 @param f function code
00513 @param extb[] external address array<br>
00514 extb[0] : first valid external address <br>
00515 extb[1] : last valid external address
00516 @param intc[] data array
00517 @param cb[] control block array <br>
00518 cb[0] : number of function to perform <br>
00519 cb[1] : returned number of function performed
00520 @return void
00521 */
00522 INLINE void cfmad(int f, int extb[], int intc[], int cb[])
00523 {
00524    int j, count;
00525    int x, q, b, c, n, a;
00526    unsigned long exts, extc, exte;
00527 
00528    exts = extb[0];
00529    exte = extb[1];
00530    count = cb[0];
00531    j = 0;
00532    came_ext(exts, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00533    do {
00534       cam24i_q(c, n, a, f, (unsigned long *) &intc[j], &x, &q);
00535       if (q == 0) {
00536          a = 0;                 /* set subaddress to zero */
00537          n++;                   /* select next slot */
00538          j++;
00539       } else {
00540          a++;                   /* increment address */
00541          ++cb[1];               /* increment tally count */
00542          ++intc;                /* next data array */
00543          --count;
00544       }
00545       came_cn((int *) &extc, b, c, n, a);
00546 
00547       if (extc > exte)
00548          count = 0;             /* force exit */
00549 
00550    } while (count);
00551 }
00552 
00553 /********************************************************************/
00554 /**
00555 Control (16bit) Address Q scan.
00556 
00557 Scan all sub-address while Q=1 from a0..a15 max from address extb[0] and store
00558 corresponding data in intc[]. If Q=0 while A<15 or A=15 then cross station boundary is applied
00559 (n-> n+1) and sub-address is reset (a=0). Perform action until either cb[0] action are performed
00560 or current external address exceeds extb[1].
00561 
00562 <b>implementation of cb[2] for LAM recognition is not implemented.</b>
00563 
00564 @param f function code
00565 @param extb[] external address array<br>
00566 extb[0] : first valid external address <br>
00567 extb[1] : last valid external address
00568 @param intc[] data array
00569 @param cb[] control block array <br>
00570 cb[0] : number of function to perform <br>
00571 cb[1] : returned number of function performed
00572 @return void
00573 */
00574 INLINE void csmad(int f, int extb[], int intc[], int cb[])
00575 {
00576    int j, count;
00577    int x, q, b, c, n, a;
00578    unsigned long exts, extc, exte;
00579 
00580    exts = extb[0];
00581    exte = extb[1];
00582    count = cb[0];
00583    j = 0;
00584    came_ext(exts, &b, &c, &n, &a);
00585    do {
00586       cam16i_q(c, n, a, f, (unsigned short *) &intc[j], &x, &q);
00587       if (q == 0) {
00588          a = 0;                 /* set subaddress to zero */
00589          n++;                   /* select next slot */
00590          j++;
00591       } else {
00592          a++;                   /* increment address */
00593          ++cb[1];               /* increment tally count */
00594          ++intc;                /* next data array */
00595          --count;
00596       }
00597       came_cn((int *) &extc, b, c, n, a);
00598 
00599       if (extc > exte)
00600          count = 0;             /* force exit */
00601 
00602    } while (count);
00603 }
00604 
00605 /********************************************************************/
00606 /**
00607 Control Full (24bit) Block Repeat with Q-stop.
00608 
00609 Execute function f on address ext with data intc[] while Q.
00610 
00611 @param f function code
00612 @param ext external address array
00613 @param intc[] data array
00614 @param cb[] control block array <br>
00615 cb[0] : number of function to perform <br>
00616 cb[1] : returned number of function performed
00617 @return void
00618 */
00619 INLINE void cfubc(const int f, int ext, int intc[], int cb[])
00620 {
00621    int count, q;
00622 
00623    count = cb[0];
00624    do {
00625       cfsa(f, ext, (unsigned long *) intc, &q);
00626       if (q == 0)
00627          count = 0;             /* stop on no q */
00628       else {
00629          ++cb[1];               /* increment tally count */
00630          ++intc;                /* next data array */
00631          --count;
00632       }
00633    } while (count);
00634 }
00635 
00636 /********************************************************************/
00637 /**
00638 Control (16bit) Block Repeat with Q-stop.
00639 
00640 Execute function f on address ext with data intc[] while Q.
00641 
00642 @param f function code
00643 @param ext external address array
00644 @param intc[] data array
00645 @param cb[] control block array <br>
00646 cb[0] : number of function to perform <br>
00647 cb[1] : returned number of function performed
00648 @return void
00649 */
00650 INLINE void csubc(const int f, int ext, int intc[], int cb[])
00651 {
00652    int count, q;
00653 
00654    count = cb[0];
00655    do {
00656       cssa(f, ext, (unsigned short *) intc, &q);
00657       if (q == 0)
00658          count = 0;             /* stop on no q */
00659       else {
00660          ++cb[1];               /* increment tally count */
00661          ++intc;                /* next data array */
00662          --count;
00663       }
00664    } while (count);
00665 }
00666 
00667 /********************************************************************/
00668 /**
00669 Repeat Mode Block Transfer (24bit).
00670 
00671 Execute function f on address ext with data intc[] if Q.
00672 If noQ keep current intc[] data. Repeat cb[0] times. 
00673 
00674 @param f function code
00675 @param ext external address array
00676 @param intc[] data array
00677 @param cb[] control block array <br>
00678 cb[0] : number of function to perform <br>
00679 cb[1] : returned number of function performed
00680 @return void
00681 */
00682 INLINE void cfubr(const int f, int ext, int intc[], int cb[])
00683 {
00684    int q, count;
00685 
00686    count = cb[0];
00687    do {
00688       do {
00689          cfsa(f, ext, (unsigned long *) intc, &q);
00690       } while (q == 0);
00691 
00692       ++cb[1];                  /* increment tally count */
00693       ++intc;                   /* next data array */
00694       --count;
00695    } while (count);
00696 }
00697 
00698 /********************************************************************/
00699 /** 
00700 Repeat Mode Block Transfer (16bit).
00701 
00702 Execute function f on address ext with data intc[] if Q.
00703 If noQ keep current intc[] data. Repeat cb[0] times. 
00704 
00705 @param f function code
00706 @param ext external address array
00707 @param intc[] data array
00708 @param cb[] control block array <br>
00709 cb[0] : number of function to perform <br>
00710 cb[1] : returned number of function performed
00711 @return void
00712 */
00713 INLINE void csubr(const int f, int ext, int intc[], int cb[])
00714 {
00715    int q, count;
00716 
00717    count = cb[0];
00718    do {
00719       do {
00720          cssa(f, ext, (unsigned short *) intc, &q);
00721       } while (q == 0);
00722 
00723       ++cb[1];                  /* increment tally count */
00724       ++intc;                   /* next data array */
00725       --count;
00726    } while (count);
00727 }
